description: A simple yet stylish mid week meal of cauliflower steaks with a vibrant beetroot and parsnip puree.
keywords: Vegetable dishes,Pescatarian,Soy free,Tree nut free,Egg free,Sesame free,Dairy free,Beetroot,Peanut free
name: Cauliflower Steaks with Beetroot & Parsnip Puree Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 0.25 tsp each paprika, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder

recipeInstructions.text: To make the cauliflower steaks first trim away excess leaves and slightly trim the bottom while keeping the stalk intact. Give a quick rinse under the tap to gently shake off extra water. Cut into half and each piece into thirds. I ended up with 2 big cauliflower steaks and smaller pieces which would suit kids as mini steaks.
Place onto lined trays and brush the tops with the oyster sauce. Give a light spray with oil. Sprinkle the combined spices over the top and bake on 200 degrees for 30 minutes.

To make the beetroot and parsnip puree peel and chop the parsnips. Put into a saucepan with just enough boiling water to cover. Place the lid on to bring to the boil then turn down to low for 20 minutes.
Drain the parsnips and add the beetroot with half of the vegetable stock. Use a stick blender to blitz. Add extra vegetable stock if needed.
Blitz until you get a glorious texture.
Serve with additional steamed veggies for a hearty vegetarian dish.
